00003 /*! \file   cavium-list.h
00004     \brief  Common: A linked list implementation used to manipulate internal
00005                     driver lists.
00006 */
00007 
00008 #ifndef _CAVIUM_LIST_H
00009 #define _CAVIUM_LIST_H
00010 
00011 
00012 struct __cavium_list_node  {
00013     struct __cavium_list_node *le_next;
00014     struct __cavium_list_node *le_prev;
00015 };
00016 
00017 
00018 typedef struct __cavium_list_node  cavium_list_t;
00019 
00020 
00021 static inline void
00022 CAVIUM_INIT_LIST_HEAD(cavium_list_t *ptr)
00023 {
00024     ptr->le_next = ptr; ptr->le_prev = ptr;
00025 }
00026 
00027 
00028 
00029 static inline
00030 void cavium_list_add_head(cavium_list_t *node, cavium_list_t *head)
00031 {
00032     head->le_next->le_prev = node;
00033     node->le_next   = head->le_next;
00034     head->le_next   = node;
00035     node->le_prev   = head;
00036 }
00037 
00038 
00039 static inline
00040 void cavium_list_add_tail(cavium_list_t *node, cavium_list_t *head)
00041 {
00042     head->le_prev->le_next = node;
00043     node->le_prev   = head->le_prev;
00044     head->le_prev   = node;
00045     node->le_next   = head;
00046 }
00047 
00048 
00049 
00050 
00051 
00052 
00053 /* Move nodes from list2 to list1. list1 must be empty. list2 will be empty
00054    when this call returns. */
00055 static inline
00056 void cavium_list_move(cavium_list_t *list1, cavium_list_t *list2)
00057 {
00058     if(list2->le_next != list2) {
00059         list1->le_next = list2->le_next;
00060         list1->le_next->le_prev = list1;
00061         list1->le_prev = list2->le_prev;
00062         list1->le_prev->le_next = list1;
00063     }
00064 
00065     list2->le_next = list2->le_prev = list2;
00066 }
00067 
00068 
00069 
00070 
00071 /* Get the node at the head of a list. The node is not removed from the list. */
00072 static inline
00073 cavium_list_t *cavium_list_get_head(cavium_list_t  *root)
00074 {
00075     if( (root->le_prev == root)  &&  (root->le_next == root) )
00076         return NULL;
00077 
00078     return root->le_next;
00079 }
00080 
00081 
00082 
00083 /* Get the node at the tail of a list. The node is not removed from the list. */
00084 static inline
00085 cavium_list_t *cavium_list_get_tail(cavium_list_t  *root)
00086 {
00087     if( (root->le_prev == root)  &&  (root->le_next == root) )
00088         return NULL;
00089 
00090     return root->le_prev;
00091 }
00092 
00093 
00094 
00095 
00096 /* Remove the node passed as argument from its list. */
00097 static inline 
00098 void cavium_list_del(cavium_list_t *node)
00099 {
00100     node->le_next->le_prev = node->le_prev;
00101     node->le_prev->le_next = node->le_next;
00102 }
00103 
00104 
00105 
00106 
00107 /* Remove the node at the head of the list. The list would be empty at
00108    the end of this call if there are no more nodes in the list. */
00109 static inline
00110 cavium_list_t *cavium_list_delete_head(cavium_list_t  *root)
00111 {
00112     cavium_list_t  *node = cavium_list_get_head(root);
00113     if(node)
00114         cavium_list_del(node);
00115 
00116     return node;
00117 }
00118 
00119 
00120 
00121 #define cavium_list_for_each(tmp, head)  \
00122     for (tmp = (head)->le_next; tmp != (head); tmp = tmp->le_next)
00123 
00124 
00125 #define cavium_list_for_each_safe(tmp, tmp2, head)  \
00126     for (tmp = (head)->le_next, tmp2 = tmp->le_next; tmp != (head); tmp = tmp2, tmp2 = tmp->le_next)
00127 
00128 
00129 #endif
